title: Amazon shares soar 14% as cloud growth beats expectations
description: The online retailer benefited as businesses continue to spend relentlessly on artificial intelligence software development
content:
Amazon's cloud revenue rose at the fastest clip in nearly three years, helping the company forecast quarterly sales above estimates and driving its shares up 14% in after-market trading.
The company projected increased capital spending next year.

title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai expresses enthusiasm over AI deal with Reliance, highlights benefits for Jio users
description: Google and Reliance Jio are joining forces to boost Artificial Intelligence use across India. Eligible Jio customers will receive Google's AI Pro plan for free for 18 months. This includes advanced AI tools and significant cloud storage. The initiative aims to empower consumers, businesses, and developers. Reliance will also partner with Google Cloud for AI hardware.

title: AI, CT Curriculum To Be Introduced From Class 3 By 2026; CBSE Sets Up Expert Committee
description: Artificial Intelligence and Computational Thinking will be introduced in all schools from Class 3 starting 2026–27 under the Ministry of Education’s plan. The move aligns with NEP 2020 and aims to equip students with essential digital and analytical skills.
content:
Last Updated:October 31, 2025, 08:36 IST
The Education Ministry will introduce Artificial Intelligence and Computational Thinking from Grade 3 in schools starting 2026–27, aligning with NEP 2020 and NCF SE 2023.

title: Wall Street indexes fall as Meta, Microsoft drag, along with Fed rate concerns
description: Indian markets saw a dip as global cues turned negative. Major US indexes like Nasdaq and S&P 500 declined. Meta and Microsoft shares dropped significantly due to increased artificial intelligence spending. The US Federal Reserve's hawkish tone also impacted investor sentiment. Investors are now closely watching upcoming earnings reports for further direction.

title: Meta to issue bonds worth up to $30 billion
description: (Reuters) -Social media giant Meta Platforms will raise money through bond offerings worth up to $30 billion, it said in a filing on Thursday, as Big Tech rushes to fund the costly expansion of artificial intelligence infrastructure.
